Sentencas: A novel hybrid compressive mica seal was developed that showed an exceptionally low leak rate of similar to8.9 x 10(-4) sccm/cm (standard cubic centimeters per minute per unit leak length of seal) at 800degreesC and a compressive stress of 100 psi, about 740 times lower than that of the conventional compressive mica seals (6.6 x 10(-1) sccm/cm), at a pressure gradient of 2 psi.
Titulo: Novel compressive mica seals with metallic interlayers for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The hybrid compressive mica seals were composed of two compliant metallic layers and a mica layer.
Titulo: Novel compressive mica seals with metallic interlayers for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Three commercially available micas were tested in this study.
Titulo: Novel compressive mica seals with metallic interlayers for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: All showed substantial improvements in reducing the leak rates by using the hybrid design.
Titulo: Novel compressive mica seals with metallic interlayers for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The best results were obtained using muscovite single-crystal mica and 125 mum silver layers.
Titulo: Novel compressive mica seals with metallic interlayers for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Using the paper form of muscovite and phlogopite mica, the leak rates were still far superior (similar to1 x 10(-1) sccm/cm) compared with mica without the compliant silver layer (about 6-9 sccm/cm).
Titulo: Novel compressive mica seals with metallic interlayers for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The microstructure of the mica was examined before and after the 800degreesC leak tests.
Titulo: Novel compressive mica seals with metallic interlayers for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: These results are compared with results for hybrid seals using glass interlayers.
Titulo: Novel compressive mica seals with metallic interlayers for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: In addition, an explanation for the substantial reduction of the leak rates is proposed, and the application of the hybrid compressive mica seals in planar SOFC stacks is briefly addressed.
Titulo: Novel compressive mica seals with metallic interlayers for solid oxide fuel cell applications
